Syrian authorities struggle with foreign jihadists
subhead: Clashes between Syrian authorities and French jihadists entrenched in the Harem camp demonstrate the challenges the new regime faces in integrating these foreign groups into society.

title: Israel army says targeted Islamic Jihad militant in Gaza strike
Trump says increasing tariffs on Canada by 10%
subhead: The announcement comes two days after Trump said he had terminated all trade talks with Canada over what he called a 'fake' ad campaign. The ad from Ontario used quotes from a 1987 radio address on trade by Reagan, where he warned about the effects high tariffs on imports could have on the US economy.

title: Left-winger Catherine Connolly wins Ireland's presidential election
subhead: Connolly, 68, secured more than 63% of the votes, well ahead of Heather Humphreys of the Fine Gael party on 29.5%. But some predict her radical views on foreign policy, social justice and housing could cause friction with the government. She is an Irish-language speaker and, like many in Ireland, vehemently pro-Palestinian.

title: The Fondation Cartier unveils its new landmark in central Paris
subhead: The Fondation Cartier for Contemporary Art has moved to Place du Palais-Royal in Paris. Like its previous location on Boulevard Raspail, the new building was designed by architect Jean Nouvel, conceived as an innovative, flexible space that can be configured in countless ways.

title: Heroes' Memorial in Kyiv carries the pain of all Ukraine
subhead: Spontaneously created after the Russian invasion, this self-managed memorial honoring fallen soldiers has become a central site for civilians and military personnel alike.

'The Louvre's stolen jewels, valuable only for their gemstones, are above all outdated and cumbersome'
subhead: Reactions to the Louvre heist ignore the complex equation museums face: offering generous public access while securing cumbersome objects better suited for a bank vault, explains Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

title: Brigitte Macron's never-ending fake news nightmare
subhead: For four years, the absurd rumor that the French first lady is a man has continually spread. The Macrons have taken legal action, both in France and in the US.

title: Twelve artistic happenings to catch outside Art Basel Paris
subhead: Alongside the fourth edition of the event, a host of events are taking place in various venues across the French capital. From exhibitions and monumental installations to off-site fairs, here is a selection from Le Monde's culture journalists.
